clusters.neutral_headline: Trump seeks $100bn for Venezuela oil, but Exxon boss says country 'uninvestable'

items.title: 1/10: Saturday Morning
items.standfirst: President Trump met with oil executives Friday amid action in Venezuela. Meanwhile, protests continued in Minnesota over the deadly ICE shooting.
items.content: President Trump met with oil executives Friday amid action in Venezuela. Meanwhile, protests continued in Minnesota over the deadly ICE shooting.

items.title: Exxon CEO calls Venezuela 'uninvestable' during meeting with Trump
items.standfirst: ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods meets President Donald Trump at the White House on Friday. Alex Wong/Getty Images The CEO of ExxonMobil said Venezuela is "uninvestable" in its current state. Darren Woods' comments came during a meeting with President Donald Trump and oil execs on Friday. Trump is…

Alex Wong/Getty Images The CEO of ExxonMobil said Venezuela is "uninvestable" in its current state. Darren Woods' comments came during a meeting with President Donald Trump and oil execs on Friday. Trump is…

items.title: Trump presses top oil executives to invest in Venezuela's reserves
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump pressed top oil executives to invest in Venezuela's reserves at a White House meeting on Friday, but was met with a cautious reception -- with ExxonMobil chief executive Darren Woods dismissing the country as "uninvestable" without sweeping reforms.
items.content: US President Donald Trump pressed top oil executives to invest in Venezuela's reserves at a White House meeting on Friday, but was met with a cautious reception -- with ExxonMobil chief executive Darren Woods dismissing the country as "uninvestable" without sweeping reforms.

items.title: Exxon CEO Tells Trump Venezuela Is ‘Uninvestable’
items.standfirst: Major US oil executives expressed caution about President Donald Trump’s push for them to spend at least $100 billion to rebuild Venezuela, with the head of Exxon Mobil Corp. calling the nation currently “uninvestable.” Trump convened nearly 20 industry representatives in the East Room of the…
items.content: Major US oil executives expressed caution about President Donald Trump’s push for them to spend at least $100 billion to rebuild Venezuela, with the head of Exxon Mobil Corp. calling the nation currently “uninvestable.” Trump convened nearly 20 industry representatives in the East Room of the…

items.title: Trump defends Venezuela action to oil executives
items.standfirst: President Trump met with oil executives on Friday after the U.S. military action in Venezuela, but some doubted the viability of revamping the country's oil reserves, which Rystad Energy estimates would take 15 years and billions of dollars.
items.content: President Trump met with oil executives on Friday after the U.S. military action in Venezuela, but some doubted the viability of revamping the country's oil reserves, which Rystad Energy estimates would take 15 years and billions of dollars.

items.title: Trump seeks $100bn for Venezuela oil, but Exxon boss says country 'uninvestable'
items.standfirst: Oil executives expressed caution, with one executive saying Venezuela had seized their assets twice.
items.content: Oil executives expressed caution, with one executive saying Venezuela had seized their assets twice.

items.title: US oil giant ExxonMobil tells Trump Venezuela is ‘uninvestable’
items.standfirst: Chief executive Darren Woods pushes back against president’s call to rush back into troubled country
items.content: Chief executive Darren Woods pushes back against president’s call to rush back into troubled country

items.title: Trump promises oil companies ‘total safety’ in Venezuela as he urges them to invest billions
items.standfirst: Country is ‘uninvestable’ today, president told, but CEOs signal they are ready to spend with supportDonald Trump promised oil giants “total safety, total security” in Venezuela in an effort to persuade them to invest $100bn in the country’s infrastructure after US forces toppled Nicolás Maduro from power.At a roundtable press conference at the White House on Friday afternoon with more than a dozen oil executives, including leaders from Chevron, ExxonMobil and ConocoPhilips, the US president doubled down on claims that Maduro’s arrest presents American oil companies with an unprecedented opportunity for extraction. Continue reading...
items.content: Country is ‘uninvestable’ today, president told, but CEOs signal they are ready to spend with supportDonald Trump promised oil giants “total safety, total security” in Venezuela in an effort to persuade them to invest $100bn in the country’s infrastructure after US forces toppled Nicolás Maduro from power.At a roundtable press conference at the White House on Friday afternoon with more than a dozen oil executives, including leaders from Chevron, ExxonMobil and ConocoPhilips, the US president doubled down on claims that Maduro’s arrest presents American oil companies with an unprecedented opportunity for extraction. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Greenland's party leaders firmly reject Trump's push for U.S. takeover of island
clusters.neutral_headline: ‘We do not want to be Americans’: Greenland parties reject Trump’s threats

items.title: Greenland's party leaders firmly reject Trump's push for U.S. takeover of island
items.standfirst: "We don't want to be Americans, we don't want to be Danes, we want to be Greenlanders," Greenland Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen and four party leaders said in a statement Friday night.
items.content: "We don't want to be Americans, we don't want to be Danes, we want to be Greenlanders," Greenland Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen and four party leaders said in a statement Friday night.

items.title: Greenland Blasts Trump's Threat to Act 'Whether They Like It Or Not'
items.standfirst: The statement followed Trump’s repeated threats to acquire the autonomous island, which is part of the kingdom of Denmark.
items.content: The statement followed Trump’s repeated threats to acquire the autonomous island, which is part of the kingdom of Denmark.

items.title: ‘We do not want to be Americans’: Greenland parties reject Trump’s threats
items.standfirst: Statement by five political parties elected to Greenland parliament says island's future must be decided by its people.
items.content: Statement by five political parties elected to Greenland parliament says island's future must be decided by its people.

items.title: Greenlanders voice concern after Trump reiterates goal to own island
items.standfirst: Greenlanders are voicing concern after US President Donald Trump on Friday again suggested the use of force to seize Greenland as he brushed aside Denmark's sovereignty over the autonomous Arctic island. Denmark and other European allies have voiced shock at Trump's threats to take control of Greenland, where the United States already has a military base.
items.content: Greenlanders are voicing concern after US President Donald Trump on Friday again suggested the use of force to seize Greenland as he brushed aside Denmark's sovereignty over the autonomous Arctic island. Denmark and other European allies have voiced shock at Trump's threats to take control of Greenland, where the United States already has a military base.

items.title: ‘We don’t want to be Americans’: Greenland’s parties respond to new Trump threat
items.standfirst: In a response to US President Donald Trump's latest threat to seize control of Greenland, the leaders of the Danish autonomous region's five main political parties issued a joint statement late Friday declaring the future of the island should be decided by Greenlanders.
items.content: In a response to US President Donald Trump's latest threat to seize control of Greenland, the leaders of the Danish autonomous region's five main political parties issued a joint statement late Friday declaring the future of the island should be decided by Greenlanders.

items.title: Jens-Frederik Nielsen, the Greenlandic leader under pressure
items.standfirst: The Arctic island’s 34-year-old prime minister is at the centre of one of the world’s most meaningful geopolitical struggles
items.content: The Arctic island’s 34-year-old prime minister is at the centre of one of the world’s most meaningful geopolitical struggles

items.title: Iran’s Prosecutor General Threatens Protestors With Death Penalty
items.standfirst: Iranians continue to take to the streets across the country as protests intensify and the government clamps down, having cut off internet access and threatening protestors with harsh penalties. On Saturday, Mohammad Movahedi Azad, Iran’s attorney general, warned that demonstrators would be…

On Saturday, Mohammad Movahedi Azad, Iran’s attorney general, warned that demonstrators would be…

items.title: Protests sweep Iran as authorities intensify crackdown on demonstrators
items.standfirst: Protests sweeping across Iran neared the two-week mark Saturday, with the country’s government acknowledging the ongoing demonstrations despite an intensifying crackdown and as the Islamic Republic remains cut off from the rest of the world.
items.content: Protests sweeping across Iran neared the two-week mark Saturday, with the country’s government acknowledging the ongoing demonstrations despite an intensifying crackdown and as the Islamic Republic remains cut off from the rest of the world.

items.title: Iran protesters tell of brutal police response as regime lashes out
items.standfirst: Videos emerging despite internet and mobile phone blackout show demonstrations continuing despite reports of escalating crackdownDemonstrators have continued to take to the streets of Iran, defying an escalating crackdown by authorities against the growing protest movement.An internet shutdown imposed by the authorities on Thursday has largely cut the protesters off from the rest of the world, but videos that trickled out of the country showed thousands of people demonstrating in Tehran overnight into Saturday morning. They chanted: “Death to Khamenei,” in reference to supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, and: “Long live the shah.” Continue reading...
items.content: Videos emerging despite internet and mobile phone blackout show demonstrations continuing despite reports of escalating crackdownDemonstrators have continued to take to the streets of Iran, defying an escalating crackdown by authorities against the growing protest movement.An internet shutdown imposed by the authorities on Thursday has largely cut the protesters off from the rest of the world, but videos that trickled out of the country showed thousands of people demonstrating in Tehran overnight into Saturday morning. They chanted: “Death to Khamenei,” in reference to supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, and: “Long live the shah.” Continue reading...

items.title: New protests erupt in Iran as supreme leader signals upcoming crackdown
items.standfirst: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei calls protesters ‘vandals’ and ‘saboteurs’ and blames US for instigating the unrestIranians took to the streets in new protests on Friday to press the biggest movement against the Islamic republic in more than three years, as authorities sustained an internet blackout as part of a crackdown that has left dozens dead.Iran’s supreme leader vowed that authorities will not back down in the face of the rapidly growing protest movement, setting the stage for an intensified violent crackdown. Continue reading...
items.content: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei calls protesters ‘vandals’ and ‘saboteurs’ and blames US for instigating the unrestIranians took to the streets in new protests on Friday to press the biggest movement against the Islamic republic in more than three years, as authorities sustained an internet blackout as part of a crackdown that has left dozens dead.Iran’s supreme leader vowed that authorities will not back down in the face of the rapidly growing protest movement, setting the stage for an intensified violent crackdown. Continue reading...

items.title: Khamenei blames Trump for inciting Iran protesters
items.standfirst: Iran’s Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, said the protesters were “a bunch of vandals” trying to please President Donald Trump, before issuing a warning that the Islamic Republic will not back down.
items.content: Iran’s Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, said the protesters were “a bunch of vandals” trying to please President Donald Trump, before issuing a warning that the Islamic Republic will not back down.

items.title: Iran shut off from the world as regime struggles to contain escalating unrest
items.standfirst: Iran’s supreme leader signaled a hard line Friday against protesters rocking the Islamic Republic, accusing them of acting on behalf of President Donald Trump as authorities struggling to contain the unrest shut the country off from the world.
items.content: Iran’s supreme leader signaled a hard line Friday against protesters rocking the Islamic Republic, accusing them of acting on behalf of President Donald Trump as authorities struggling to contain the unrest shut the country off from the world.

clusters.title: Anti-ICE protesters plan rallies across US after killing of Minneapolis woman
clusters.neutral_headline: Anti-ICE protesters plan rallies across US after killing of Minneapolis woman

items.title: Anti-ICE protesters plan rallies across US after killing of Minneapolis woman
items.standfirst: Activists are set to attend hundreds of rallies in cities across the US on Saturday and Sunday to protest the fatal shooting of 37-year-old Renee Good by an ICE officer in Minneapolis on Wednesday. The agent who shot Good said he acted in self-defence but local officials say footage of the incident shows Good did not pose a threat to him.
items.content: Activists are set to attend hundreds of rallies in cities across the US on Saturday and Sunday to protest the fatal shooting of 37-year-old Renee Good by an ICE officer in Minneapolis on Wednesday. The agent who shot Good said he acted in self-defence but local officials say footage of the incident shows Good did not pose a threat to him.

items.title: Minneapolis police detain at least 30 protesting ICE killing of local woman
items.standfirst: Minneapolis police say at least 30 people were detained on Friday night as the city reels from the fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good on Wednesday by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer. “Over the course of the night, individuals threw snow, ice, and rocks at officers, police vehicles,…
items.content: Minneapolis police say at least 30 people were detained on Friday night as the city reels from the fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good on Wednesday by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer. “Over the course of the night, individuals threw snow, ice, and rocks at officers, police vehicles,…

items.title: Protests against ICE planned nationwide after shootings
items.standfirst: Protests against immigration enforcement have been planned across the country after federal officers shot three people in Minneapolis and Portland.
items.content: Protests against immigration enforcement have been planned across the country after federal officers shot three people in Minneapolis and Portland.

items.title: Protests continue in Minneapolis amid new video of Renee Good's last moments
items.standfirst: Warning: video might be disturbing. Protests continued into the weekend in Minneapolis over the fatal shooting of Renee Good by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer. On Friday Vice President JD Vance shared a new video of the officer's point of view, which shows Good's final moments.
items.content: Warning: video might be disturbing. Protests continued into the weekend in Minneapolis over the fatal shooting of Renee Good by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer. On Friday Vice President JD Vance shared a new video of the officer's point of view, which shows Good's final moments.

items.title: Congress debates what to do about ICE after giving Trump billions of funding to expand the program
items.standfirst: The killing of a Minnesota woman by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer is reverberating across Capitol Hill where Democrats, and certain Republicans, are vowing an assertive response as President Donald Trump’s aggressive deportation operations spark protests nationwide. Lawmakers are…
items.content: The killing of a Minnesota woman by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer is reverberating across Capitol Hill where Democrats, and certain Republicans, are vowing an assertive response as President Donald Trump’s aggressive deportation operations spark protests nationwide. Lawmakers are…

items.title: New video filmed by ICE agent emerges of Minnesota woman’s killing
items.standfirst: A conservative US news site on Friday published a video filmed by the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent who fatally shot a woman in Minneapolis, showing her final moments. Amid mass protests, Trump administration officials say the agent fired in self-defence, but policing experts say the clip demonstrates that the officers did not perceive the woman to be a threat.
items.content: A conservative US news site on Friday published a video filmed by the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent who fatally shot a woman in Minneapolis, showing her final moments. Amid mass protests, Trump administration officials say the agent fired in self-defence, but policing experts say the clip demonstrates that the officers did not perceive the woman to be a threat.

items.title: Lammy says Vance thinks sexualised AI deepfakes 'entirely unacceptable'
items.standfirst: David Lammy has said that US vice president JD Vance agrees that sexualised AI-generated deepfakes - such as those made using Elon Musk's Grok - are "entirely unacceptable".
items.content: David Lammy has said that US vice president JD Vance agrees that sexualised AI-generated deepfakes - such as those made using Elon Musk's Grok - are "entirely unacceptable".

items.title: David Lammy: JD Vance agrees that sexualised AI images on X are ‘unacceptable’
items.standfirst: US vice-president ‘sympathetic’ to concerns over Grok-generated pornography, says deputy PM JD Vance, the US vice-president, has agreed that it is “entirely unacceptable” for platforms such as X to allow the proliferation of AI-generated sexualised images of women and children, David Lammy has…
items.content: US vice-president ‘sympathetic’ to concerns over Grok-generated pornography, says deputy PM JD Vance, the US vice-president, has agreed that it is “entirely unacceptable” for platforms such as X to allow the proliferation of AI-generated sexualised images of women and children, David Lammy has…

items.title: David Lammy: JD Vance agrees that sexualised AI images on X are ‘unacceptable’
items.standfirst: Exclusive: US vice-president ‘sympathetic’ to concerns over Grok-generated pornography, says deputy PMJD Vance, the US vice-president, has agreed that it is “entirely unacceptable” for platforms such as X to allow the proliferation of AI-generated sexualised images of women and children, David Lammy has told the Guardian.The deputy prime minister said Vance, usually known as an AI enthusiast, expressed concern about how the technology was being used to fuel “hyper-pornographied slop” online when they met in Washington on Thursday. Continue reading...
items.content: Exclusive: US vice-president ‘sympathetic’ to concerns over Grok-generated pornography, says deputy PMJD Vance, the US vice-president, has agreed that it is “entirely unacceptable” for platforms such as X to allow the proliferation of AI-generated sexualised images of women and children, David Lammy has told the Guardian.The deputy prime minister said Vance, usually known as an AI enthusiast, expressed concern about how the technology was being used to fuel “hyper-pornographied slop” online when they met in Washington on Thursday. clusters.title: Ukrainian drones set fire to Russian oil depot after Moscow launches new hypersonic missile
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukrainian drones targeting energy infrastructure spark fire in Russian oil depot

items.title: Ukrainian drones set fire to Russian oil depot after Moscow launches new hypersonic missile
items.standfirst: The strike comes a day after Russia bombarded Ukraine with hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles, including a powerful new hypersonic missile that hit western Ukraine.
items.content: The strike comes a day after Russia bombarded Ukraine with hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles, including a powerful new hypersonic missile that hit western Ukraine.(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)

items.title: Russian oil depot fire after Ukrainian drone strike - as UN to meet over hypersonic missile attack
items.standfirst: A drone strike by Ukraine has caused a fire at an oil depot in Russia's southern Volgograd region, according to regional authorities.
items.content: A drone strike by Ukraine has caused a fire at an oil depot in Russia's southern Volgograd region, according to regional authorities.

items.title: Ukrainian drones targeting energy infrastructure spark fire in Russian oil depot
items.standfirst: A Ukrainian drone attack sparked a fire in southern Russia, local authorities said on Saturday, as Kyiv continues to target Russian energy sites in a bid to deprive Moscow of oil revenue. The Ukrainian attack came one day after Russia fired a powerful hypersonic missile at Western Ukraine.
items.content: A Ukrainian drone attack sparked a fire in southern Russia, local authorities said on Saturday, as Kyiv continues to target Russian energy sites in a bid to deprive Moscow of oil revenue. The Ukrainian attack came one day after Russia fired a powerful hypersonic missile at Western Ukraine.

clusters.title: Musk Calls UK ‘Fascist’ as Row Over X’s Grok AI Images Escalates
clusters.neutral_headline: Musk Calls UK ‘Fascist’ as Row Over X’s Grok AI Images Escalates

items.title: Musk Calls UK ‘Fascist’ as Row Over X’s Grok AI Images Escalates
Musk Calls UK ‘Fascist’ as Row Over Grok AI Images Escalates
items.standfirst: Elon Musk accused the UK government of being “fascist” after it stepped up threats to block X over sexualized images of women and children produced by his artificial intelligence tool Grok.
items.content: Elon Musk accused the UK government of being “fascist” after it stepped up threats to block X over sexualized images of women and children produced by his artificial intelligence tool Grok.

items.title: Musk's Grok under fire for generating sexualized images
items.standfirst: European officials and tech campaigners on Friday slammed Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok after its controversial image creation feature was restricted to paying subscribers, saying the change failed to address concerns about sexualized deepfakes. Grok has faced global backlash after it emerged the feature allowed users to sexualize images of women and children using simple text prompts such as "put her in a bikini" or "remove her clothes."
items.content: European officials and tech campaigners on Friday slammed Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok after its controversial image creation feature was restricted to paying subscribers, saying the change failed to address concerns about sexualized deepfakes. Grok has faced global backlash after it emerged the feature allowed users to sexualize images of women and children using simple text prompts such as "put her in a bikini" or "remove her clothes."

items.title: Elon Musk’s Grok AI Blocked in Indonesia Over Sexualized Content
items.standfirst: Indonesia blocked access to Grok after an investigation into the artificial intelligence system’s generation of sexual content.
items.content: Indonesia blocked access to Grok after an investigation into the artificial intelligence system’s generation of sexual content.

items.title: XAI Limits Grok Images After Uproar Over Sexualized Content
items.standfirst: Elon Musk’s xAI restricted Grok’s image-generation feature for most users on the X social media platform after the artificial intelligence tool drew widespread condemnation for generating undressed images of women and children.
items.content: Elon Musk’s xAI restricted Grok’s image-generation feature for most users on the X social media platform after the artificial intelligence tool drew widespread condemnation for generating undressed images of women and children.

items.standfirst: The Oreshnik missile struck close to Ukraine's border with Poland, a NATO member.
items.content: The Oreshnik missile struck close to Ukraine's border with Poland, a NATO member.

items.title: Russia hits Ukraine with rarely used Oreshnik missile in fresh strikes
items.standfirst: It is only the second time Moscow has deployed the hypersonic ballistic missile, which was first used to hit Dnipro in November.
items.content: It is only the second time Moscow has deployed the hypersonic ballistic missile, which was first used to hit Dnipro in November.

items.title: Russia fires advanced new ballistic missile at Ukraine
items.standfirst: Russia attacked Ukraine overnight with a new hypersonic ballistic missile, only its second use of an advanced weapon it says can travel up to 10 times the speed of sound and is unstoppable by air defenses.
items.content: Russia attacked Ukraine overnight with a new hypersonic ballistic missile, only its second use of an advanced weapon it says can travel up to 10 times the speed of sound and is unstoppable by air defenses.

clusters.title: Nigeria overturn Algeria to set up AFCON semi-final clash with Morocco
clusters.neutral_headline: Impressive Nigeria beat Algeria 2-0 to set up AFCON semifinal with Morocco

items.title: Nigeria overturn Algeria to set up AFCON semi-final clash with Morocco
items.standfirst: Nigeria secured a 2-0 victory over Algeria in their Africa Cup of Nations quarter-final match on Saturday, with striker Victor Osimhen scoring one goal and setting up the second. Nigeria will next face tournament hosts Morocco in the semi-finals.
items.content: Nigeria secured a 2-0 victory over Algeria in their Africa Cup of Nations quarter-final match on Saturday, with striker Victor Osimhen scoring one goal and setting up the second. Nigeria will next face tournament hosts Morocco in the semi-finals.

items.title: Impressive Nigeria beat Algeria 2-0 to set up AFCON semifinal with Morocco
items.standfirst: Victor Osimhen scores one and sets up another to send Nigeria into the last four of the Africa Cup of Nations.
items.content: Victor Osimhen scores one and sets up another to send Nigeria into the last four of the Africa Cup of Nations.

items.title: Hosts Morocco beat Cameroon to advance to AFCON semi-finals
items.standfirst: Brahim Diaz kept up his remarkable Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) scoring record as hosts Morocco beat Cameroon 2-0 in their quarter-final showdown on Friday to keep their title dreams alive. Meanwhile Iliman Ndiaye scored in the first half to give Senegal a 1-0 victory over Mali.
items.content: Brahim Diaz kept up his remarkable Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) scoring record as hosts Morocco beat Cameroon 2-0 in their quarter-final showdown on Friday to keep their title dreams alive. Meanwhile Iliman Ndiaye scored in the first half to give Senegal a 1-0 victory over Mali.

items.title: US hiring held firm in December capping weakest year of growth since pandemic
items.standfirst: White House is meanwhile facing questions about an apparent embargo breach over Trump’s social media postHiring held firm in the US last month, official data showed, amid uncertainty over the strength and direction of the world’s largest economy.Employers added 50,000 jobs to the US labor force last month, capping the weakest year of growth since the pandemic, according to data released from the US Bureau of Labor Statistics on Friday. clusters.title: Trump administration suspends $129m in benefit payments to Minnesota
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump administration suspends $129m in benefit payments to Minnesota

items.title: Trump administration suspends $129m in benefit payments to Minnesota
items.standfirst: USDA notified state’s governor of decision, citing inquiries into alleged fraud by local non-profits and businessesThe Trump administration announced it is suspending $129m in federal benefit payments to Minnesota amid allegations of widespread fraud in the state.The secretary of the US Department of Agriculture (USDA), Brooke Rollins, shared a letter on Friday on social media that was addressed to Minnesota’s governor, Tim Walz, and the mayor of Minneapolis, Jacob Frey, notifying them of the administration’s decision and citing investigations into alleged fraud conducted by local non-profits and businesses. Continue reading...
items.content: USDA notified state’s governor of decision, citing inquiries into alleged fraud by local non-profits and businessesThe Trump administration announced it is suspending $129m in federal benefit payments to Minnesota amid allegations of widespread fraud in the state.The secretary of the US Department of Agriculture (USDA), Brooke Rollins, shared a letter on Friday on social media that was addressed to Minnesota’s governor, Tim Walz, and the mayor of Minneapolis, Jacob Frey, notifying them of the administration’s decision and citing investigations into alleged fraud conducted by local non-profits and businesses. Continue reading...

items.title: Over $120M in USDA award payments to MN suspended, Sec. Rollins says
items.standfirst: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said on Friday that she is suspending payments on all active and future awards from the USDA to Minnesota amid the long-running fraud scandal in which the White House has alleged a misuse of federal funds.
items.content: U.S. Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said on Friday that she is suspending payments on all active and future awards from the USDA to Minnesota amid the long-running fraud scandal in which the White House has alleged a misuse of federal funds.

clusters.title: Rare first Superman comic once stolen from Nicolas Cage sells for $15m
clusters.neutral_headline: Rare first Superman comic once stolen from Nicolas Cage sells for $15m

items.title: Rare first Superman comic once stolen from Nicolas Cage sells for $15m
items.standfirst: Fewer than 100 copies of Action Comics No 1, which introduced the world to Superman, are thought to exist.
items.content: Fewer than 100 copies of Action Comics No 1, which introduced the world to Superman, are thought to exist.

items.title: Comic book copy introducing Superman sells for $15 million
items.standfirst: A rare copy of the comic book that introduced the world to Superman and also was once stolen from the home of actor Nicolas Cage has been sold for a record $15 million. The private deal for “Action Comics No. 1” was announced Friday. It eclipses the previous record price for a comic book, set last November when a copy of “Superman No. 1″ was at sold at auction for $9.12 million.
items.content: A rare copy of the comic book that introduced the world to Superman and also was once stolen from the home of actor Nicolas Cage has been sold for a record $15 million. The private deal for “Action Comics No. 1” was announced Friday. It eclipses the previous record price for a comic book, set last November when a copy of “Superman No. 1″ was at sold at auction for $9.12 million.

clusters.title: Indonesia temporarily blocks Grok due to the risk of AI-generated pornographic content, becoming the first country to deny access to the AI tool
clusters.neutral_headline: Indonesia blocks Musk’s Grok chatbot due to risk of pornographic content

items.title: Indonesia temporarily blocks Grok due to the risk of AI-generated pornographic content, becoming the first country to deny access to the AI tool
Indonesia blocks Musk’s Grok chatbot due to risk of pornographic content
items.standfirst: Move comes after governments and regulators from Europe to Asia have condemned the AI tool and some have opened inquiries into sexualised contentIndonesia temporarily blocked Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot on Saturday due to the risk of AI-generated pornographic content, becoming the first country to deny access to the AI tool.The move comes after governments, researchers and regulators from Europe to Asia have condemned and some have opened inquiries into sexualised content on the app. Continue reading...
items.content: Move comes after governments and regulators from Europe to Asia have condemned the AI tool and some have opened inquiries into sexualised contentIndonesia temporarily blocked Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot on Saturday due to the risk of AI-generated pornographic content, becoming the first country to deny access to the AI tool.The move comes after governments, researchers and regulators from Europe to Asia have condemned and some have opened inquiries into sexualised content on the app. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Man dies after tree falls onto caravan during Storm Goretti
clusters.neutral_headline: Man dies after tree felled by Storm Goretti hits caravan in Cornwall

items.title: Man dies after tree falls onto caravan during Storm Goretti
items.standfirst: Police say a man in his 50s died in the incident in Helston during Storm Goretti.
items.content: Police say a man in his 50s died in the incident in Helston during Storm Goretti.

items.title: Man dies after tree felled by Storm Goretti hits caravan in Cornwall
items.standfirst: Warnings in place covering most of the weekend as weather system continues to sweep UKA man has been found dead after a tree fell on to a caravan during Storm Goretti, as weather warnings have been put in place covering most of the UK for the rest of the weekend.Devon and Cornwall police said emergency services were called at about 7.35pm on Thursday to the Mawgan area of Helston where work took place on Friday to remove the tree. A man in his 50s was found dead in the caravan. His death is not being treated as suspicious and his next of kin have been informed, police said. Continue reading...
items.content: Warnings in place covering most of the weekend as weather system continues to sweep UKA man has been found dead after a tree fell on to a caravan during Storm Goretti, as weather warnings have been put in place covering most of the UK for the rest of the weekend.Devon and Cornwall police said emergency services were called at about 7.35pm on Thursday to the Mawgan area of Helston where work took place on Friday to remove the tree. A man in his 50s was found dead in the caravan. His death is not being treated as suspicious and his next of kin have been informed, police said. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Signs of life detected from rubbish avalanche which killed four
clusters.neutral_headline: Rescuers race to find dozens missing in deadly Philippines landfill collapse

items.title: Signs of life detected from rubbish avalanche which killed four
items.standfirst: Signs of life have been detected by rescuers searching for more than 30 people missing after an avalanche of rubbish that left four workers dead at a landfill site in the central Philippines.
items.content: Signs of life have been detected by rescuers searching for more than 30 people missing after an avalanche of rubbish that left four workers dead at a landfill site in the central Philippines.

items.title: Rescuers race to find dozens missing in deadly Philippines landfill collapse
items.standfirst: The landslide happened when a mountain of rubbish collapsed at a landfill site in the central Philippines.
items.content: The landslide happened when a mountain of rubbish collapsed at a landfill site in the central Philippines.

items.title: One dead, dozens trapped after giant landfill collapses in Philippines
items.standfirst: Rescuers have pulled 12 injured sanitation workers from debris at the private landfill in Cebu City.
items.content: Rescuers have pulled 12 injured sanitation workers from debris at the private landfill in Cebu City.
